newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks lose more than 50 points by midday.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks lose more than 50 points by midday.

text.p: * Toronto stocks were hit by profit-taking by Friday's midday after recent record highs. * Investors were concerned by surprisingly firm U.S. data pointing to possible rate hike.
Toronto stocks lost their gains of the past two days by midday on Friday, with investors reaping profits after unexpectedly strong U.S. economic statistics re-ignited fears of an interest rate hike.
The Toronto Stock Exchange's key 300 Composite Index tumbled 58.49 points to reach 6819.19 in moderate turnover of 41 million shares worth C$748 million.
All of Toronto's 14 sub-sectors shed points except for real estate. Conglomerates, pipelines and banks lost the most.
Canadian Pacific Ltd, which makes up almost 2.6 percent of the key index, fell 1.40 to 41.40 in active dealings.
